metadata.title: CVE-2015-0469 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle Java SE 5.0u81, 6u91, 7u76, and 8u40allows remote attackers to affect confidentiality, integrity, andavailability via unknown vectors related to 2D.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-0469` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

icedtea-7-jre-jamvm - 7u79-2.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
openjdk-7-demo - 7u79-2.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
openjdk-7-jdk - 7u79-2.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
openjdk-7-jre - 7u79-2.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
openjdk-7-jre-headless - 7u79-2.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
openjdk-7-jre-lib - 7u79-2.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
openjdk-7-jre-zero - 7u79-2.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
openjdk-7-source - 7u79-2.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-7 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7u79-2.5.5-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
openjdk-6 package in trusty was vulnerable and has been fixed, but no release version available for it (note: '6b35-1.13.7-1ubuntu0.14.04.1 ').
